review_blob: Almost no head, fuzz, medium body. Lime, orange peel, grain. Simple and refreshing.
Mango, grapefruit. Body and carbonation on a low side. Dry. Your average nw IPA.
Gingerbread cake, banana/prune, some milk chocolate. Some sourness, a touch of bitterness mostly in the aftertaste, pleasant low sweetness, low carbonation. Wonderful warmth in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Huge carbonation, lots of foam, creamy. Belgian yeast, pineapple, oak/vanila. Dry finish. Not a fan of a style, but this one was good.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Harvest Dance Wheat Wine

review_blob: Draught. Like someone has mentioned, this is indeed more of a double saison with xtra hops. Delicious.
beer_name: Flying Dog In de Wildeman Farmhouse IPA

review_blob: Draught. Thick Foam. Smell - hey, tobacco, roasted coffee beans. Earthy, dry. Light body and carbonation. Haunting bitter finish.
Beautiful color of rose wine. Smells like cherry lollipop. Light tartness, sweet and sticky on the tongue, but surprisingly dry and flowery on the finish.
Smell is grass, pine, toasted bread. Rather light body and low carbonation, but together with the the mild flavor this brew is somehow surprisingly pleasant.
beer_name: Deschutes Red Chair Northwest Pale Ale

review_blob: Despite the style, no banana/clove smell whatsoever; nice belgian yeast and citrus flavor through.
Light body, dough/bread and sugar in the nose and in the mouth, bitterish aftertaste. Not very pleasant.
Flowers,fruit,light caramel in the nose. Slightly sweet with bitter finish. Pleasant acidity, medium body, great balance.
Twist off cap bottle. Chestnut brown with a very thin head. Toffee, bread. Sweet malt and syrup, virtually no hop smell/flavor. Sticky, mid body, mid sourness. Meh

Straw yellow, flower and slightest grain smell. Medium body, mild carbonation. Tastes sourish, dry, makes your mouth pucker, slightly bitter finish. Kinda like flamish sour, but a lager...I suspect its not appropriate for the style, I did enjoy it though. Very drinkable, refreshing and cheap.

Dark amber beer with big shored-lived head. Not very aromatic - you can smell alcohol and bread - thats it. Toasted bread and burned sugar. Creamy, a tad sweet, alcohol is evident but pleasant. Slightly bitter finish.
Smells...sour. And it is sour on the palate with slightly bitter finish. Toasted bread, a bit of caramel and crabapple.
Toasted bread and caramel in the nose. About the same in the mouth, very rye-ish. Long sweet toasted bread aftertaste.
Gotta be the best blonde Ive ever had. Flower and grain in the nose. Grain in the mouth. Super light and drinkable, not fuzzy, with just a perfect bitterness in the aftertaste. Bravo!
Nutty smell. Black/Burned malt, coffee, hazelnut(?); creamy texture and good acidity. Bitterness from the roast - very pleasant.
Smell is floral, a little earthy. Citrus, spice, grain malt. Pleasant acidity and bitterness level. Great spicy finish.
Beautiful ruby red brew; sour cherries. Tastes like cherries and cider/vinegar, fuzzy and tart; nectarous. Cherries in the aftertaste.
Smell is lemon and belgian yeast; flavor is of lemon peel, bitter orange. Bitterness, acidity and just barely there alcohol are in great balance. Very drinkable.

Pleasant smell - sugar, spice, flower. Sip - and my first instinct is to spit it out.  This party in my mouth is very unpleasant: fuzzy, sweet, bitter - you can definitely locate ginger and caramel, but together they just feel like hangover.
Aroma of apple blossom and honey; lively carbonation, pleasant tartiness; fruit and a bit of bitterness in the lingering aftertaste.
Vanilla, bourbon, molasses; pleasant alcohol burn. Complex, almost like sipping a whiskey. Very sweet; mouthfeel was rather unpleasant, will not buy again.
A bit sour, mild carbonation - goes flat and tasteless very fast; delicate hazelnut flavor, superb hazelnut aftertaste. Not a session beer.
Pleasant nuttiness, not too sweet, A LOT of diacetyl. Very round. Had it more body, would be a great beer.

Virtually no smell - very very very subtle belgian yeast, fine head; tasted as subtle as it smelled. Then I had some fries with it, and...wow, the beer bloomed. Honey, apricot, apple blossom. Very enjoyable with food, pretty unimpressive by itself.
beer_name: Elysian Bte Blanche Belgian Tripel (2011 and later)

review_blob: Pepper and chocolate in the nose - fantastic! Aftertaste - hot and awesome. Had it on tap at elysian triangle pub and It tasted like band-aid/medicine. Was it a combination of chili, chocolate, roasted malt and reisiny hops or a sanitizer is a question. It sure wasnt good. I suggest you ask for a taster before ordering a pint.
beer_name: Elysian 12 Beers of Apocalypse # 4 - Peste Chocolate Chili Ale

review_blob: Surprising. Cantaloupe and flowers in the nose; very light for a winter ale; lingering bitter aftertaste.
Molasses, toast, slightly nutty; medium body, noticeable and longish bitter aftertaste.
Thick head. Roasted malt and semi-sweat chocolate. Medium body, nice carbonation. Very balanced and gulpable. Just enough of a bitter bite in the aftertaste.
Smell of grapefruit; medium mouthful, nice carbonation, a bit of spice/heat on the tongue. Bitterness more in the aftertaste. Very drinkable IPA.

April 2012, tap. Smells like a sweet fruit - mango/cantaloupe(just want to keep breathing it in). Same fruit on a palate, noticeable bitterness in the aftertaste. Very light and smooth -  I could drink a lot of this beer. Fruity for a bitter, but super enjoyable.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Floral and citrus smell; mild orange taste; not that bitter at all. Treat on a palate - nice balance, acidity and carbonation; perfect aftertaste - slightly bitter with alcohol warmth.
Creamy foam, medium body, good carbonation. Nose is of yeast, spice, flowers - very perfume-y. Too sweet to my taste. LOVE the aftertaste: slightly tangy&bitter; maybe a honeydew.
Nice carbonation; lemon in the nose, a little zest in the aftertaste. Unfortunately, tastes pretty uninteresting; dare I say, It smells better.
Delicate smell of floral hops; creamy head, thin  body. Bread, lemon. I like the slightly bitter aftertaste. Solid brew, great for a warm day.
Some bread in the nose; medium body, rather herby then bitter. Very drinkable with some sourness.
I smell vanilla and roast; tastes semi-sweet chocolate and raisins. Kinda thin, but good.
beer_name: Black Diamond Peak XV Imperial Porter

review_blob: Surprisingly good. Smells roasty - tastes smokey, some light lingering bitterness. Very drinkable and pleasant.
Certainly interesting... Agreed on chai, juniper berries and banana. Really pungent and, honestly, kind of soapy.

One of a kind beer! Made with Theos chocolate. Tried it on tap at Chocofest event at Pike Brewery. Straw in color; light, crisp and drinkable: amazing smell of milk chocolate, and tastes just like it! For a minute I thought my senses were playing trick on me - this is the most chocolaty beer Ive every had!
Dangerously drinkable, carbonated. Smells like saison yeast; tastes slightly sour and very, very lemony. Would be great in summer time!
Smell of  bitter chocolate, vanilla. Nice body. Almost port-like; very dark chocolate, bourbon and rum-soaked raisins. In my world beer doesnt get better that this.
beer_name: Full Sail Black Gold Imperial Stout Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: april 2012 on tap at Hales. Smell of semi-sweet chocolate; very pleasant on a palate; creamy; raisin and chocolate, very well-balanced. Hales absolute favorite.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Beautiful in the glass, very thick foam. Creamy on the palate. Dark chocolate, banana, a little alcohol, slightly bitter aftertaste. If this was a man, Id merry him right away.
Now thats a kick in the head. Tastes so hoppy, its overwhelming, which makes a  great beer to sip when already drunk. Very one dimensional to me; still, worth trying.
Not much in terms of aroma; pleasant creamy palate, nice head. Herby, a little caramel, kick of hops. I remember thinking: "It doesnt taste like a blonde"!
beer_name: Naked City Attack of the 50 Ft. Woman

review_blob: Great IPA. Flowery, citrucy. More aromatic, then bitter. Refreshing, medium body.
Favorite Maritime brew. As someone mentioned, 2011 was very decent; great balance for a winter ale.
beer_name: Maritime Pacific Jolly Roger Christmas Ale
